item.title: By: Maxi
item.dc:creator: Maxi
item.description: Hello, I was trying this but ran into problems with installing mencoder on Windows 10. I struggled through all the readmes and help documents, but it seems I am too stupid to get this running. I have the the source and the codecs unpacked in a "mencoder" folder in :C//. What do I have to do that the Program will be found by Windows, so that the given code works?
item.content:encoded: Hello, I was trying this but ran into problems with installing mencoder on Windows 10. I struggled through all the readmes and help documents, but it seems I am too stupid to get this running. I have the the source and the codecs unpacked in a “mencoder” folder in :C//. What do I have to do that the Program will be found by Windows, so that the given code works?

item.title: By: Arthur
item.dc:creator: Arthur
item.description: Edit (to initial comment above): I found that the problem was that I deleted "mf://" before "*.png". As soon as I included that again it worked.
item.content:encoded: Edit (to initial comment above): I found that the problem was that I deleted “mf://” before “*.png”. As soon as I included that again it worked.

item.title: By: Arthur
item.dc:creator: Arthur
item.description: Nothing happens when I try to change the frame rate - that is, changing "fps=25" to "fps=3" does absolutely nothing. The .avi video is made at a set frame rate that I can't seem to change. Any advice?
item.content:encoded: Nothing happens when I try to change the frame rate – that is, changing “fps=25” to “fps=3” does absolutely nothing. The .avi video is made at a set frame rate that I can’t seem to change. Any advice?

item.title: By: Navneet
item.dc:creator: Navneet
item.description: I am doing a simulation in which,no of lattice points are increasing with time, is there any method in gnuplot animations so that, i can see the evolution of the lattice with no. of points increasing in it ?
item.content:encoded: I am doing a simulation in which,no of lattice points are increasing with time, is there any method in gnuplot animations so that, i can see the evolution of the lattice with no. of points increasing in it ?
